oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poetry; Nostalgia; Patriotism
World War, 1939-1945 -- Europe; Prisoners of war; Diaries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This page is a poem or list of things that Mitchener misses and craves during his imprisonment in a POW camp in Germany. He has then included a small poem that reads,"I have loved those things/Gentle living our country gave/You'll find them where freedom rings/Land of the free, home of the brave." He has also included some tiny drawings that accompany the longer poem, which include pictures of Cupid, an old woman's head, a flag, a mask, a cup of coffee, a steak, a deck of cards, and coins, etc.

Hardy A. Mitchener, Jr. was shot down and captured as a POW during World War II after a bombing mission in Germany. He served as a second Lieutenant in the 509th Bombardment Squadron, 351st Bombardment Group, 8th Air Force. Mitchener attended high school in Nashville, Tennessee, at Isaac Litton High School, and then attended Vanderbilt University. He survived the war, but he died in his late 30s in 1957. He was married to Estelle Waddell Mitchener at the time of his death.
